text: the easier one to start with so we have our folks over here at Austin private wealth relatively unknown realistically before this they do have some good Google reviews though good for them and you can see that there was a really interesting trade that came through at some point so essentially right before this assassination attempt underwent there was a massive massive trade that came through people thought that was interesting timing and there's a little bit more to it than that it doesn't boil down at least as far far as I can see to that so what happened here pretty simple we saw this trade come through and this was the filing date that is important to differentiate from when the trade went on there are leads and leads and lags to when trades are placed versus when they are filed so in this case the position was on since 30 June and this is when they chose to file and this fell in line with when they tend to file their stuff historically the other thing that we noticed here is that there was a pretty interesting unilateral issue with their data and you can see that they use a third-party vendor and they applied essentially a 10,000 contract multiplier for everything not just djt all their stuff so this does look like a fantastically strangely timed clerical error and this does happen this is one of the issues when we have a little too much
